definitions: A Canadian immigration program designed to help employers in the Atlantic provinces (New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia, and Prince Edward Island) hire foreign skilled workers and international graduates.
A pathway for eligible immigrants to obtain permanent residency in Canada by filling labor market needs in the Atlantic region.
examples: The Atlantic Immigration Program has been successful in attracting new residents.
Employers can utilize the Atlantic Immigration Program to address labor shortages.
Applying through the Atlantic Immigration Program requires a job offer from a designated employer.
